big_picture: Today's policy headlines from India highlight key developments in national security, international relations, and judicial affairs. Union Minister Amit Shah led a discussion on cybercrime threats and responses, while Prime Minister Modi received a warm welcome in Israel, marking the beginning of a 2-day visit. Meanwhile, the Gujarat High Court criticized the state government for its delayed response to a case, warning officials against engaging in unproductive litigation. The Congress party also weighed in on PM Modi's visit to Israel, expressing criticism towards the Indian government's relationship with Israel.

The trip is expected to strengthen economic and strategic cooperation between the two countries. The visit marks a significant development in India's relations with Israel.

perspectives.title: Rupee ends flat at 90.95 amid US dollar demand and NDF maturities

story_clusters.summary: The Indian rupee's bond rally has paused, with traders awaiting the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) decision on liquidity measures. The rupee's value has stabilized, ending flat at 90.95 against the US dollar. Market demand for the US dollar and non-deliverable forward (NDF) maturities have contributed to the rupee's stability.

The Congress party has criticized Prime Minister Modi's relationship with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu, stating that the international community is critical of it.

Foreign.summary: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has begun a 2-day visit to Israel, receiving a red carpet welcome, as the trip aims to upgrade strategic ties between the two countries. The visit is seen as a test of India's ability to balance its relationships in the Middle East.
Foreign.top_article_title: Modi Receives Red Carpet Welcome as He Begins 2-Day Visit to Israel

Trade.summary: The Indian government is currently assessing the implications of the US Supreme Court ruling on Trump-era tariffs and the potential impact of US tariff changes on India's trade, with Finance Minister Sitharaman stating that it's too early to comment on the effects. The US has also imposed initial duties of 126% on Indian solar imports.

Finance.summary: The Indian government is revising tax rules and guidelines for agricultural projects and services provided to statutory authorities under the Income Tax Act and GST respectively. The sector is also being shaped by court decisions, with the Delhi High Court recently rejecting a PIL related to an Air India plane crash investigation report.

The event aimed to enhance global cooperation in combating ransomware attacks and improving cyber security resilience.

Energy.summary: India's energy sector is witnessing significant developments, with POWERGRID commissioning a project to evacuate 8.1 GW of solar power from Rajasthan and Vikram Solar securing a 378 MW module supply order from a NTPC-Indian Oil joint venture. NTPC has also tendered green ammonia and methanol projects in Andhra Pradesh, further promoting India's transition to renewable energy sources.

Education.top_article_title: Ruskin Bond's Life Story Now In Telugu

Health.summary: The Delhi government is expanding its Atal Canteens near hospitals, increasing the service hours to 12 hours to provide better food options to patients and their families. Agriculture.summary: India's Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) has amended the wheat export policy, permitting the export of 25 lakh metric tonnes (LMT) of wheat despite the continued prohibition on wheat exports. articles.title: GST on Pure Services to Statutory Authorities After Circular 245/2025
articles.summary: The Indian government has clarified the GST exemption for services provided to statutory authorities. The exemption is available only if the services are pure, provided to eligible government bodies, and linked to constitutional functions. This clarification aims to provide clarity on GST exemptions for government bodies.

articles.title: US Hits Indian Solar Cells with 126% Preliminary Countervailing Duties
articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Commerce (Commerce) has announced its preliminary determination of countervailing duties of up to 125.87% on crystalline silicon solar cells, whether or not assembled into modules, imported from India. The preliminary duties were announced following an investigation after trade petitions were filed by the Alliance for American Solar Manufacturing and Trade last July. Commerce had initiated anti-dumping duty (AD) and countervailing duty (CVD) investigations in August 2025.

articles.title: Restaurant Services through E-Commerce under GST: Are Composition Dealers Allowed?
articles.summary: The GST authority has clarified that composition dealers can supply restaurant services through e-commerce platforms without restrictions. This means that e-commerce operators will continue to pay GST on behalf of the suppliers. The clarification aims to simplify the GST compliance process for small businesses.
articles.raw_summary: Since restaurant services are notified under Section 9(5), GST is paid by the e-commerce operator and not the supplier. Therefore, composition dealers are not restricted from supplying through such platforms. articles.title: The Ayyappa awaits: Sabarimala supreme's sanctum nears Supreme Court's final verdict
articles.summary: ​In 2006, the Indian Young Lawyers Association approached the Supreme Court of India, arguing that barring women violated constitutional guarantees of equality and freedom of religion. By 2016, the Court began openly questioning whether such a ban could withstand constitutional scrutiny. In September 2018, a five-judge Constitution Bench delivered a 4 to 1 verdict that shook Kerala.

articles.title: Government Approves Higher Equity Investment Cap for POWERGRID
articles.summary: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) has raised the permissible equity investment limit for Power Grid Corporation of India (POWERGRID) in its subsidiaries to ₹75 billion (~$825.25 million) per subsidiary, up from ₹50 billion (~$550.17 million). However, POWERGRID’s investments in its subsidiaries must not exceed 15% of its net worth. POWERGRID’s equity investment threshold in subsidiaries was raised under the extant guidelines on the delegation of powers applicable to central public

articles.summary: India's fifth major expressway, the Delhi-Amritsar-Katra route, will be ready by March 2027. This project significantly cuts travel time between Delhi and Katra to six hours. Construction faced delays but has now regained momentum.

articles.title: Fresh math for world's fastest growing economy: What's behind India's GDP revision and why it matters
articles.summary: India's new GDP revision is set to reflect new way of measuring the economy, shifting the base year for GDP to 2022–23. Authorities will also publish revised figures for earlier years to align them with the new benchmark. The goal is to make the numbers more realistic and responsive to today’s economy, including evolving spending patterns and the expansion of online and tech-driven activity.

articles.title: SC Dismisses IBC Challenge to Benami Attachment Because NCLT Lacks Jurisdiction
articles.summary: The Supreme Court dismissed a challenge to Benami attachment under the Benami Act, ruling that insolvency tribunals lack jurisdiction. This decision affects the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) and the Benami Act. The ruling has significant implications for asset confiscation and insolvency proceedings in India.
articles.raw_summary: Supreme Court held that attachment orders under the Benami Act cannot be challenged before NCLT under IBC, as the Act provides an exclusive adjudicatory mechanism. Insolvency tribunals cannot review sovereign confiscation proceedings. The post SC Dismisses IBC Challenge to Benami Attachment Because NCLT Lacks Jurisdiction appeared first on TaxGuru .

This change aims to ensure compliance and prevent deductions without proper reporting. The rule will impact organizations claiming deductions under Section 45(4)(a).
articles.raw_summary: Draft Rule 31 requires research institutions and eligible companies to file Form 15 and issue Form 16 certificates to donors for claiming deductions under Section 45(4)(a). Without proper reporting and certification, deduction will not be allowed, making compliance mandatory. The post Draft Income Tax Rule 31   Statement of Donation Particulars and Donor Certificate Under Section 45(4)(a) appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Draft Income Tax Rule 30 – Prescribed Authority & Approval Process for Scientific Research Expenditure under Section 45(3)(c)
articles.summary: The Indian government has proposed a new rule for scientific research expenditure under Section 45(3)(c). The rule outlines the authorities, approval process, and reporting requirements for sponsored research. This change aims to regulate and streamline scientific research funding in India.
articles.raw_summary: Draft Rule 30 sets out the prescribed authorities, approval timeline, forms, and strict reporting conditions for sponsored scientific research under Section 45(3)(c). The rule mandates feasibility review, time-bound approval, audited accounts, and detailed progress reporting. articles.title: India must develop sovereign AI to avoid digital colony risk, says Sarvam AI Co-founder Vivek Raghavan
articles.summary: Building foundational AI technology is a necessity rather than an option for India to maintain its digital independence, said Sarvam co-founder, Vivek Raghavan. He noted that AI impacts every aspect of human life, making it a core technology that the country must understand at a fundamental level. "Otherwise, we will become a digital colony which is dependent on other countries for this core, core technology," he noted.
